content:
Staying near Shinjuku station is a great idea, as it's a major hub with easy access to many parts of Tokyo.

Regarding your flight deal, congratulations on scoring a good price! $850 for a round-trip economy ticket is a great deal.

Now, about the Suica or Pasmo card: Absolutely, I highly recommend purchasing one of these cards for your trip! They're prepaid IC cards that can be used to ride trains, buses, and subways throughout Tokyo, making it super convenient to get around the city.

Here's why:

* Convenience: You don't need to buy individual tickets every time you ride a train or bus. Just tap your card and go!
* Time-saving: You won't need to wait in line to buy tickets or worry about finding the right change.
* Cost-effective: You can save money by not having to buy individual tickets, which can add up quickly.
* Wide acceptance: Suica and Pasmo cards are widely accepted at most train stations, buses, and subways in Tokyo, as well as some vending machines and shops.

You can purchase a Suica or Pasmo card at most train stations, including Narita Airport and Shinjuku Station. The initial cost is around ¥2,000-¥3,000, which includes a ¥500 deposit that you can refund when you return the card.

You can also purchase a Suica or Pasmo card online in advance through services like Japan Experience or Japan Rail Pass, which can be convenient if you want to have it ready for your arrival.

Both Suica and Pasmo cards are similar, but Suica is more widely accepted, especially on Japan Railways (JR) trains. Pasmo is more commonly used on non-JR trains and subways.

For a 7-day trip, I'd recommend purchasing a Suica or Pasmo card with a minimum balance of ¥2,000-¥3,000, depending on your travel plans. You can always top up your card at train stations or convenience stores if you need more credit.

Enjoy your trip to Tokyo, and I hope you find the Suica or Pasmo card convenient and cost-effective for your travels!
